title: Staff Arrives Late Repeatedly
summary: An employee has been late three times this week. Ask about the underlying issue first, then set clear expectations; standards and compassion can coexist.

scene.setting: An employee has been late three times this week. You may feel frustrated or avoidant; the hidden risk is signaling that standards don't apply. The decision point is avoid discomfort vs uphold standards fairly.

beats.narration: The pattern is clear. The decision point is warning only or ask first then set expectations.

dialogue.speaker: lead
dialogue.line: I've noticed the lateness. I want to understand what's going on—then we need to be clear about expectations.

choices.label: Issue a warning immediately and document the pattern.

steps.step: Document; then ask what's going on; clear consequence if pattern continues; support or adjustment if possible.

leader_lines: I've documented the pattern. I also want to know—what's going on? Is there something we can fix?
Here's the expectation and what happens if it continues.
questions: How do you pair accountability with inquiry?
What support or adjustment might help?
scripts.closing_line: Document; ask; clear consequence; support if possible.

choices.label: Ask about the underlying issue first, then set clear expectations.

steps.step: Private conversation: ask what's going on; then set clear expectation and consequence.
If legitimate barrier: flexible start, temporary accommodation, or clear timeline for improvement.

leader_lines: What's going on? I want to understand before we set expectations.
Here's what we need going forward—and what happens if it continues.
questions: What if there is a legitimate barrier?
scripts.closing_line: Ask first; clear expectations; support or consequence.

choices.label: Do nothing and hope it improves.

steps.step: Address as soon as pattern appears: private conversation; document and follow up.

leader_lines: I need to address this. When can we talk privately?
questions: How do we document and follow up?

choices.label: Mention it casually in passing without a formal conversation.

steps.step: Schedule private meeting; clear policy and consequence; written follow-up.

leader_lines: Casual doesn't convey importance. Let's have a proper conversation.
How do you make the conversation count?
scripts.closing_line: Scheduled private meeting; clear policy; written follow-up.

system_prompts.mirror_call: Did you avoid discomfort or uphold standards fairly?

outcomes.message: The pattern may continue. Other staff may resent; standards erode.
reflection_questions: What would have changed with ask-first-then-standards?

outcomes.message: Standards upheld and compassion shown. You may have found a fix or set a clear expectation.
reflection_questions: What if there was a legitimate barrier?
How do you pair accountability with inquiry?

tsp.weekly_pulse_prompt: This week I upheld standards with compassion. (1-5)
